jobDescription:
Collecte d'enregistrements vocaux en français (Canada)
Nous recherchons des personnes en Canda pour lire et enregistrer de courtes phrases en utilisant notre application Appen Mobile.

Dans ce projet, Appen collecte des données vocales en français pour entraîner et développer des algorithmes d'intelligence artificielle. Vos enregistrements audios seront utilisés pour améliorer les technologies de reconnaissance vocale.
Tâche : Votre session contient un total de 600 phrases courtes que vous devez lire sur un écran et enregistrer à l'aide de l'application pour smartphone Appen Mobile. Vous devez simplement suivre les phrases écrites en français, il n'est pas nécessaire de créer vos propres phrases.Exemple d'une phrase que vous devrez lire : "Ok Alexa, j'ai besoin de l'itinéraire pour aller au travail".
Durée : Chaque phrase prendra en moyenne 3 à 6 secondes. Au total, pour les 600 enregistrements, veillez prévoir environ 3 heures. Bien sûr, nous vous recommandons de faire des pauses et nous vous donnerons au moins 7 jours pour enregistrer votre session.
Paiement : Nous vous paierons 60 $ pour ce projet. Le paiement sera effectué après l’envoi des 600 enregistrements, une fois ceux-ci vérifiés en contrôle qualité. Si vous avez moins de 600 enregistrements audio acceptés, nous vous paierons proportionnellement (minimum requis : 80% d’enregistrements acceptés).
Conditions requises :
Avoir un smartphone récentSi vous avez un iPhone, cela doit être un iPhone 8 ou plus récentLes smartphones Android doivent être de 2017 ou plus récentsAvoir le français (accent Canadien) comme langue maternelle et résider en CanadaPouvoir enregistrer dans un environnement intérieur très calme, sans bruit de fond.
companyDescription:
We help our clients enhance their best-in-class products and services around the world, including search engines, social media platforms, voice recognition systems, sentiment analysis, and eCommerce sites. All of that wouldn’t be possible without our team of more than 1 million flexible workers. The world of tech is moving fast, and we help our clients meet the ever-changing needs of their customers. We take pride in our diverse, international team and the flexible and full-time opportunities we offer.

Remote work is changing how the world does business, and we’re proud to be pioneers in the movement. If you’re looking for a work-from-home opportunity, join us! At Appen, our team is an international force to be reckoned with. Operating in over 130 countries and working in more than 180 languages and dialects, we support the work of some of the world’s top technology companies. With Appen, you’ll get to work on innovative projects and grow your skills – all on your own schedule.

Please be aware that Appen recruiters will only reach out to you via official channels (e.g., directly from @appen.com email addresses, or through our recruiters who are noted as such on LinkedIn). If you have suspicions about an interaction, ask for official email communications from an @appen.com. We will never ask you to send money to apply or start a job with us. We will also never send a check in advance. We will never ask you to send personal identifiable information outside of our secure job site, Appen Connect. All job applications should be submitted through our Jobs page to the applicable site.

jobDescription:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leaders partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
We are looking for a hands-on Big Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team. The role of Big Data Engineer in our Datahub team is accountable for delivering the solutions of assigned big data applications throughout the complete use case lifecycle
What can you expect in this role?
Data Engineer is expected to design, develop, test, implement data ingestion, transformation, and extraction to and from Big Data/cloud Platforms using tools and technologies including but not limited to spark frameworks, Sqoop, Hive, HBase, Impala, Python, Scala ,ControlM, Big query, Databricks, Datafusion Kafka and shell scriptingHands-on application design, coding, and deployment of medium and significant Complex data PipelinesClose collaboration across engineering team on product strategies that align with business pain points andAbility to understand requirements, create BSTM, build business logic and ability to learn and quickly adopt for changing needsActively participate in addressing non-functional requirements such as performance, security, scalability, continuous integration, migration and compatibilityContribute to Best practices of data ingestion, transformation and extraction solutions in big data platform (Datahub) and Cloud Data platformsExperience in building Data Architectures and exposure to Dimensional Data ModelingTake ownership from design of the feature through first lines of code to how it performs in production (You build it, you run it)Ensure fully automated testing by designing and writing automated unit, integration and acceptance testsActs as a SME / Trusted day-to-day advisor to development teams on application portfolio, SDLC and development design frameworks, components and services re-useProvides key inputs into future technology direction and areas associated stability, performance, and roadmap strategy and development initiatives for applications in the portfolioStrong experience in using DevOps toolsChampions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environmentResponsible for creating functions, applications or databases that run on the cloud
What do you bring to the role?
BS/MS in computer science or equivalent technical experienceShould have worked in Hadoop ,cloud and Data Engineering space for at least 2+ yearsMinimum of 4 to 6 years of development experience handling variety of data (structured/unstructured), data formats (flat files, XML, JSON, relational, legacy, parquet)Experience in developing batch and real time data streams to create meaningful insights and analyticsStrong understanding of different file formats (e.g. AVRO, ORC, Parquet, etc..) and data sources moving data into and out of HDFSCoding background in either Java, Spark or Python, some experience with Shell and Ansible writingGood knowledge of issue tracking (Jira), source code management (Bitbucket), Continuous Integrations tools (Jenkins), Linux/Mac OS administration, build tools, package management and testing framework.Good knowledge of networking, CPU, memory, storageGood to have Cloud Experience and cloud data technologiesWorking Experience with ETL/ELT toolsExperience in Cloud Engineering (Google Cloud Experience is an asset)Should have worked under agile methodologyEfficient in communication, able to work with cross teams
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).
companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Get to know our family of companies:
Economical Insurance
Sonnet Insurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline Insurance
-
Definity investit dans des activités multicanaux afin d’offrir à nos concitoyens canadiens des options de couverture optimales pour leurs domiciles, véhicules, fermes, animaux de compagnie et entreprises.

Nous sommes fiers d’être Canadiens et nous offrons une gamme de solutions d’assurance adaptées ainsi qu’un service à nos clients d’un bout à l’autre du pays. Definity a des racines profondes, qui remontent au 25 novembre 1871, lorsque notre marque fondatrice, l’Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, a émis sa première police pour protéger l’étable et la maison d’Ismael D. Bowman. Aujourd’hui, Definity poursuit sa tradition d’offrir aux Canadiens un excellent service, tant par l’entremise d’un courtier d’assurance autorisé que par notre réseau numérique direct.

Découvrez notre famille de compagnies :
Assurance Economical
Sonnet Assurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline

jobDescription:
Nous sommes à la recherche d'un Chargé de projets - Développement afin d'appuyer le directeur, Développement et projets majeurs en surveillant l’ensemble du processus des projets, en examinant et en faisant des recommandations fréquemment. Assurer la liaison et la gouvernance de diverses équipes internes (Investissements et Développement, Finance, Location et Affaires juridiques), des consultants et des entrepreneurs à l’externe. Aider les équipes interfonctionnelles en ce qui a trait à divers aspects des projets de re développement, ainsi qu’à l’encadrement de projets d’aménagement locataire dans les propriétés. Au besoin, contribuer à la mise à jour ou à la révision de politiques de l’Entreprise. Protéger la position contractuelle de Groupe Petra et voir à ce que les projets terminés répondent aux standards établis dans le contrat.
Lieu : 800 rue du Square-Victoria, Montréal
Principales tâchesGérer et coordonner les projets du Développement afin de respecter les échéanciers et budgetsAssurer la communication entre les diverses équipes et intervenants (internes / externes)d’affaires, professionnels, entrepreneurs, locataires, municipalités, etc )Organiser les rencontres d’équipe, des consultants et visiter les chantiers de façon périodique Rendre compte de l'avancement des projets, analyser les risques, proposer des alternativesGérer et coordonner les équipes multidisciplinaires impliquées pour la réalisation des projetsDonner des directives claires aux professionnels et s’assurer qu’ils respectent les orientations du projet (techniques et budgétaire, ainsi que la gestion des contrats et fermeture du projet).Participer à la planification des projets et à l'élaboration de l'étendue des travaux.Gérer le processus d’appels d’offres et de soumissions des projets Développementque les invitations des soumissionnaires, ouvertures, analyses et octrois de contrats )Assurer la conformité des documents liés au processus de construction (assurances, contrats, dessins d’atelier, fiches techniques, garanties, permis de construction, programme de prévention CNESST, plans tel que construit, quittances, etc.)Diriger et coordonner les travaux de construction des projets développement, d’ingénierie et services requis: (budgets, échéanciers, modifications des contrats et négociations)Évaluer et prévoir les principales difficultés et contraintes tout au long du déroulement des projets (Assurer la qualité de construction et le respect des standards spécifiques)Réviser et recommander les certificats de paiement et la facturation pertinente aux projetsAssurer le bon déroulement des chantiers avec l’équipe constructionÉtablir et conserver un climat de confiance avec les clients (Interne/ Externe) tout en protégeant les relations d’affaires Exigences requises du posteDétenir un diplôme d’études universitaires de premier (1er) cycle en architecture ou ingénierie ou une technique en architecture.Expérience minimum de sept (7) années reconnues dans le domaine de la construction et de la gestion de projets (développeur, propriétaire de parc immobilier, entrepreneur, etc.)Compétences éprouvées en communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit, et capacité à transmettre des messages difficiles avec tact et diplomatie.Capacité à faire de solides présentations avec assurance et crédibilité.Démontrer une ouverture d’esprit et souplesse tant dans son approche que dans ses façons de faire. Avoir de l’empathie et toujours mettre de l’avant une approche client.Capacité de suivre les directives et prendre des initiatives au besoinEsprit d'équipe et capacités de leadership entre les différents intervenantsConnaissance de l'environnement professionnelOrientation vers un travail/service de qualité (Résolution de problèmes)Connaissances techniques et professionnellesSens de l'organisation et Gestion des prioritésAutonome et responsable.Habileté de négociation
Ce que nous vous offronsUn environnement de travail accueillant et convivial;Une rémunération et des avantages sociaux concurrentiels ;Le remboursement des frais d’adhésion d’association professionnelle;Un programme de formation et un plan de développement des compétences;Une ouverture aux nouvelles idées.
Bâtir une carrière, ensemble.Les collaborateurs de Groupe Petra contribuent grandement à son succès. Notre compagnie a bâti une équipe solide avec des professionnels compétents qui reflètent notre culture et nos valeurs. Travailler chez Groupe Petra est l’opportunité d’avoir une carrière épanouissante et stimulante.
companyDescription:
GROUPE PETRA présente un portefeuille diversifié  d’immeubles de qualité supérieure qui répondent à des critères d’occupation des plus élevés.

GROUPE PETRA est une société de gestion privée, active dans le marché immobilier depuis 30 ans. Détenant des immeubles de bureaux, commerciaux et industriels situés dans les régions de Montréal, Québec et Toronto elle assure la gestion complète de ses immeubles, incluant la location d’espaces, l’aménagement, la construction et l’entretien.

Le portefeuille immobilier du GROUPE PETRA a fait l’objet d’acquisitions successives pour atteindre aujourd’hui 10,2 millions de pieds carrés.
jobIndustries: Real Estate, Commercial Real Estate, Construction

jobDescription:
Why you’ll love Softchoice:
We are a software-focused IT solutions and services provider that equips organizations to be agile and innovative, and for their people to be engaged, connected, and creative at work. That means moving them to the cloud, helping them build the workplace of tomorrow, and enabling them to make smarter decisions about their technology. By doing these things we help them create success for their customers and their people.
We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.
The impact you’ll have:
As the Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for partnering with the business owner and the development team to assist in the definition, design, documentation and implementation of business solutions. A Sr. Business Analyst will collaborate with Business stakeholders to help craft a technical roadmap that aligns with the achievement of key business objectives. They will bring a technical lens to all solutions to drive industry leading best practices and implementations. They are also responsible for ensuring business involvement throughout the system development lifecycle and that the business requirements are fulfilled.
  As the Senior Business Analyst, you will:  

 Engage with the various business units across the organization at the senior leadership level to identify business needs, create roadmaps and drive incremental business value.  Act as a mentor to Business Analysts providing guidance on day-to-day activities and career journey discussions.  Work with the Solution Delivery team to provide input into on PMO process to drive continuous improvement.  Lead and participate in IT Steering Committee sessions and conduct planning sessions with the business owners  Work with the business to conduct benefits analysis and identify issues and risks  Work with the Solution Delivery team to perform cost benefits analysis and develop project management documentation  Define detailed functional and non-functional requirements, in conjunction with the business  Conduct research and analysis of solution options where applicable, including analysis of fit to functional and non-functional requirements  Liaises with delivery team to ensure the alignment and traceability of technology solution designs to business requirements  Develop and update business requirements documents and process flows  Lead user acceptance testing activities for the developed solution  Assist in development and execution of training and change management  Participate in lessons learnt and continuous improvement  Track and document the business and stakeholders’ satisfaction through informal business impact statements or formal satisfaction surveys  Build trusted relationship with business units  Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of the business and the current IT environment  Monitor and measure key metrics across the various processes and solutions 

What you'll bring to the table:

 6+ years of related work experience  Experience in large business transformation programs  A solid technical background with demonstrated experience in a multi-platform enterprise environment.  One or more industry recognized certifications in the areas of Business Analytics, Agile Methodologies, Change Management or Project Management  One or more industry recognized certifications in Salesforce and/or SAP enterprise platforms  Strong problem-solving skills with proven application in the design and implementation of a business solution  Strong business acumen with a proven ability to identify business solutions using a variety of methods (independent research, voice of business, voice of customer)  Demonstrated ability to self-learn and stay aware of industry trends  Demonstrated ability to ideate, design and execute on solution delivery with a focus on customer outcomes and customer experience  Proven ability to present and communicate at all levels with clarity and precision both written and verbally 

Not sure if you qualify? Think about applying anyway:
We understand that not everyone brings 100% of the skills and experience for the role.
At Softchoice, we offer opportunities to a diverse group including those with a variety of workplace experiences and backgrounds. Whether you are new to corporate tech, returning to work after a gap in employment, or looking to transition and take the next step in your career, we are excited to learn more about you and encourage you to apply.
Why people love working here:

We offer hybrid and remote working opportunities. Comprehensive benefits from day one of employment. We offer meaningful work and opportunities for career growth. Our team members have 2 paid volunteer days per year to give back to a cause of their choice. We offer an opportunity to build and grow a career in the technology industry. Recognized as a Best Workplace in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute for 17 consecutive years. Softchoice has been certified as a Great Place to Work in the United States for several years. We have also been recognized as a Best Workplace for Women, Best Workplace for Inclusion, Best Workplace for Giving Back and Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality. We have raised over $3 million through Softchoice Cares, our grassroots fundraising organization. 

Inclusion & Equal opportunity employment:
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, inclusion & belonging. People seeking employment at Softchoice are considered without regard to any protected category including but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.
Require accommodation? We are ready to help:
We are proud to provide interview & employment accommodation during the recruitment and hiring process. If you require any accommodation to apply or interview for a position, please reach out directly to asktalentacquisition@softchoice.com . We are committed to working with you to best meet your needs.
Our commitment to your experience:
We are committed to the safety of all applicants and team members. With that in mind, we have implemented digital interviewing for everyone. We understand that you may need to interview with distractions around you (such as children or furry friends) and we will be doing the same.
Before you start with us, we will conduct a criminal record check, verify your education, and check your references.
When you join Softchoice, we will onboard you remotely. Don't worry. It's quick, simple and you'll be connected with your new team in no time.
Job Requisition ID: 4566
EoE/M/F/Vet/Disability 
Associate

jobDescription:
Job description:

 About Us As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe-- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development-- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.

 Who we are We are seeking a highly motivated and career minded individual to join our team as a Unit Manager, looking after the analytics team in our Business Intelligence and Analyst department. 

 Position Details What You Will Do:

  Provide overall leadership and management of Analytics Associates supporting Club & Automotive, Retail and Manitoba Insurance Engage the business with insights and data-driven recommendations while delivering key business reporting Provide analytics support on cross-functional project teams Guide the development & delivery of prescriptive and predictive analytics solutions  Ensure standardization and documentation of current processes Identify new opportunities to utilize technology to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the Reporting and Analytics group Develop Business Intelligence applications (Qlikview, Power, BI etc.) to be used for accessing reports and data Drive the implementation and monitoring of reports and analytics developed Establish acceptable performance expectations to ensure the requirements of the business are upheld Partner with the other analytics teams to establish a centre of excellence for discussion on analytical approaches, best practices, etc.  Who You Are:

  10+ years of expert-level experience with BI tools (PowerBI, QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau) 10+ years of expert-level hands-on coding in SQL and DAX 7+ years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server architecture, administration and management 7+ years of experience with Microsoft Visual Studio  5+ years of experience with query debugging, optimization and performance tuning in a big data environment 3+ years of experience with SAP B/W Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access) Proficiency in business intelligence lifecycle Experience developing and implementing enterprise-scale reports and dashboards Ability to take complex data and visualize to identify and describe creative solutions to analytical and data problems Ability to develop analytical frameworks and generate / communicate business insights Attention to detail and high aptitude for problem solving Good communication skills  Our Commitment Get ready to drive your career forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development - and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results.

 We are caring. We are leaders. We are innovators. We are collaborative. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.

  We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

 As an organization we are focused on Member safety, which includes the safety and well-being of our Associates. Therefore, you must be and remain fully vaccinated as a condition of employment.
companyDescription:
In 2017, CAA South Central Ontario announce its historic merger with CAA Manitoba and we will now be known as CAA Club Group of companies. This new partnership reflects the successful and growing attributes of our organization. 

While our name may have changed, our core business values have not. At the heart of our business is our desire to provide our Members with peace of mind and quality service through our roadside assistance, automotive, insurance, travel and rewards businesses. We continuously strive to enhance our value to Members and Associates and ensure we are socially responsible.

companyName: Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC) Société canadienne d'hypothèques et de logement(SCHL)
jobDescription:
ID de la demande d'emploi: 8690
Désignation linguistique: Anglais essentiel
Niveaux de compétence linguistique (Lire/écrire/parler): ZZZ
Salaire de base minimum: 78657.14
Type d'emploi: Permanent à plein temps
Exigences relatives aux déplacements: Déplacements limités
Emplacement du bureau: Calgary (AB); Halifax (NS); Montréal (QC); Ottawa (ON); Toronto (ON); Vancouver (BC)
À la SCHL, nous vous faisons confiance pour faire votre travail. Nous donnons à nos employés les moyens d'être autonomes et responsables de l'atteinte de leurs résultats. Les employés se concentrent sur la façon dont ils obtiennent des résultats, plutôt que sur le moment et le lieu où ils choisissent de travailler.
Voici quelques-unes des raisons pour lesquelles nous avons été choisis comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada :
Cinq semaines de vacances.Une prime de rendement individuelle annuelle.Un régime de retraite à prestations déterminées.Une assurance collective complète pour favoriser votre bien-être dès le premier jour.L'accès à un catalogue de cours pour l'apprentissage individuel.Une culture et un environnement de travail inclusifs, plusieurs groupes-ressources d'employés et bien plus encore!
Aidez à faire une différence dans la vie des Canadiens. L’aspiration de la SCHL est de faire en sorte que, d’ici 2030, tout le monde au Canada puisse se payer un logement qui répond à ses besoins. Tous nos programmes et toutes nos activités appuient cet objectif unique.
Faites partie d’un milieu de travail inclusif. La diversité et l’inclusion guident tout ce que nous faisons à la SCHL. Nous prenons  des mesures concrètes  pour éliminer le racisme et faire progresser l’équité au sein de la SCHL et du système de logement.
Joignez-vous à l’équipe de gouvernance des données, où nos partenaires considèrent la SCHL comme le catalyseur pour résoudre les problèmes d’abordabilité du logement. Dans ce poste, vous êtes principalement responsable de la documentation et de la tenue à jour des règles de qualité des données, de la traçabilité des données et du catalogue de données, et vous assurez que la documentation est complète, exacte et conforme aux directives, aux lignes directrices et aux normes.
Il y a 2 postes disponibles.
Responsabilités
Agir à titre de spécialiste des actifs de données et jouer un rôle actif au sein des groupes de travail sur les données afin de remplir un mandat donné ou de résoudre un problème particulier; Veiller à ce que les accès soient accordés conformément aux règles fournies par le secteur d’activité, surveiller le registre d’accès aux données et signaler les problèmes potentiels à la personne responsable des données;Conseiller les intervenants opérationnels sur l’application de divers contrôles de gestion des données à l’appui des lignes directrices et des normes, notamment la classification des données, la conservation et l’élimination des données et les métadonnées; Agir à titre de premier point de contact pour les demandes liées aux données, comme les exigences relatives au profilage des données, l’aide pour les enquêtes sur les problèmes de qualité des données ou l’information concernant l’emplacement des actifs de données et la façon d’y accéder;Collaborer avec les spécialistes des divisions et les responsables des données pour documenter les métadonnées (y compris les définitions des termes opérationnels et la classification des données), évaluer et peaufiner les règles de qualité des données et proposer des améliorations à la qualité des données;Produire des rapports et des tableaux de bord pour surveiller la qualité des données et les progrès et le rendement en matière de gouvernance de l’information.
Qualifications Essentielles
Baccalauréat en informatique, en science des données, en gestion de l’information ou dans tout autre domaine connexe; une combinaison équivalente d’études ou d’expérience peut être prise en considération;Au moins cinq années d’expérience professionnelle en gestion ou en gouvernance des données, y compris une expérience récente en gestion de projets de données; Expérience avérée dans la configuration ou la mise en œuvre de règles de qualité des données et de son utilisation (p. ex., Collibra et Informatica);Solide compréhension des principes de gouvernance des données et du processus de gestion des données, y compris le cycle de vie de la gestion des données; Solides aptitudes organisationnelles et capacité à travailler simultanément sur plusieurs initiatives et à respecter des échéances serrées; Excellentes aptitudes à communiquer et à faire des présentations, avec la capacité de communiquer des informations techniques à un public non spécialisé.
Date de fermeture : Ce poste sera affiché jusqu’à ce qu’une candidature soit retenue.
AVIS IMPORTANT – EXIGENCES DE VACCINATION OBLIGATOIRE CONTRE LA COVID-19
La SCHL a établi des exigences en matière de vaccination afin de s’aligner sur les mesures de vaccination obligatoire du gouvernement du Canada pour la fonction publique fédérale.
La vaccination contre la COVID-19 est obligatoire pour tout le personnel de la SCHL, peu importe le lieu de travail (travail à domicile, à distance ou sur place). Les mesures de vaccination de la SCHL, mises à jour au besoin, font partie des conditions d’emploi.
De ce fait, pour le moment, la SCHL n’impose pas de condition d’emploi qui nécessite la vaccination complète pour les membres du personnel. Elle continuera de surveiller la situation relative à la santé publique et peut, en tout temps, apporter des ajustements et adopter ou rétablir des mesures, y compris des exigences obligatoires en matière de vaccination, d’attestation et de vérification. De telles mesures de vaccination, mises à jour au besoin, feront partie intégrante des conditions de votre emploi à la SCHL.
La SCHL est un milieu de travail inclusif où la diversité de pensée — et des personnes — est reconnue, valorisée et jugée essentielle à la réalisation de notre aspiration .
Nous sommes déterminés à assurer l’équité en matière d’emploi et encourageons activement les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées, les anciens combattants et les personnes de toutes les races, ethnicités, religions, capacités, orientations sexuelles et identités et expressions de genre à poser leur candidature. Nous acceptons également les candidatures de personnes qui ne sont pas canadiennes et qui ont le droit de travailler au Canada.
Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt toutefois seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés. Veuillez noter que nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes sélectionnées pour la suite du processus. Veuillez nous indiquer si vous avez des besoins spéciaux dont nous devrons tenir compte si vous êtes l’une des personnes convoquées à une entrevue ou appelées à passer un test.
companyDescription:
Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC) has been helping Canadians meet their housing needs for more than 70 years. 

As Canada’s authority on housing, we contribute to the stability of the housing market and financial system, provide support for Canadians in housing need, and offer unbiased housing research and advice to Canadian governments, consumers and the housing industry. Prudent risk management, strong corporate governance and transparency are cornerstones of our operations.

Terms of use: http://ow.ly/ioDX30kT0PX


La Société canadienne d'hypothèques et de logement (SCHL) aide les Canadiens à répondre à leurs besoins en matière de logement depuis plus de 70 ans. 

En tant qu’autorité en matière d’habitation au Canada, nous contribuons à la stabilité du marché de l’habitation et du système financier, nous venons en aide aux Canadiens dans le besoin et nous fournissons des résultats de recherches et des conseils impartiaux aux gouvernements, aux consommateurs et au secteur de l’habitation du pays. Nous exerçons nos activités en nous appuyant sur trois principes fondamentaux : gestion prudente des risques, solide gouvernance d’entreprise et transparence.

Conditions d'utilisation: http://ow.ly/tLh730kT0Ri

jobDescription:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 65,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 12,000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP
We value our people and our reputationWe are locally dedicated with international scaleWe are future focused and challenge the status quoWe foster collaboration in everything we doWe have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable
 RICHMOND HILL, OAKVILLE, or MISSISSAUGA 

WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms – made stronger with the recent creation of WSP E&I Canada Ltd., a wholly-owned subsidiary of WSP Canada Inc.

We have over 63,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 12,000 people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

The Opportunity

You’ll be part of our growing environmental team in Ontario which includes engineers, geoscientists, technicians, and other professionals. This team collaborates on a regular basis and are involved in exciting multi-disciplinary projects with other teams at our industry leading WSP organization

 Why WSP? 
We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and BelongingOur Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives. Our Hybrid Work Policy - a combination of in-person and remote working, enables us to purposefully think of how we work, who we need to work with, and where the work should be done. A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.
We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAre WSP 

A Day In The Life
You’ll be managing and coordinating projects including providing technical support and report preparation (Phase I and II ESAs, Baseline ESAs, landfill and site groundwater monitoring programs, peer reviews and remediation projects).You’ll support transactional due diligence projects and portfolios including technically demanding projects with multi-disciplinary teams and tight timelines;You’ll ensure that you maintain an up-to-date knowledge of existing and emerging environmental regulatory requirements and best practices;You’ll strive to deliver high quality environmental services to our Clients keeping to agreed budgets and deadlines;You’ll prepare and support proposal preparationYou’ll provide oversight and mentoring to more junior staffYou’ll liaison with clients, regulators and subcontractors  What you'll bring to WSP ... 
University Degree in a related field such as environmental science, geology, geography, or environmental/civil engineering and designation as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) or Professional Geoscientist (P.Geo.);Registered as a Qualified Professional (QP) for Environmental Site Assessments in the Province of Ontario;Five or more years of related experience;Ability to manage the demands of multiple concurrent projects and challenging deadlines;Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team;Proficiency in MS Word and Excel are essential. Experience with other data management software an asset.Ability to plan and deliver high quality reports, have strong technical writing skills and can present information concisely and clearly.Understanding of budget management, report preparation, and client relationship management.Working knowledge with Ontario Regulation 153/04, as amended, and O.Reg. 406/19.Flexibility to travel periodically. Possess a valid Ontario G License.You are passionate about personal and professional growth, working collaboratively to meet and exceed client expectations, and develop innovative solutions
Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.

Richmond Hill, ON

Intermediate (6 - 10 years)

Z-WSP E&I Canada Ltd.

Mississauga, Ontario, Canada/, Oakville, Ontario, Canada/, Richmond Hill, Ontario, Canada/
companyDescription: Named to LinkedIn's list of Top Companies in Canada for two years running, WSP is one of the world's leading professional services consulting firms. We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international expertise. We are technical experts and strategic advisors including engineers, technicians, scientists, planners, landscape architects and urban designers, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals. We design lasting solutions in the Buildings, Transportation, Infrastructure, Environment, Geomatics, Energy, Resources, and Industrial sectors as well as project delivery and strategic consulting services. With over 8,000 talented people across Canada, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for generations to come.
jobIndustries: Civil Engineering, Oil & Energy, Renewables & Environment

jobDescription:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leaders partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
We are looking for a hands-on Big Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team. The role of Big Data Engineer in our Datahub team is accountable for delivering the solutions of assigned big data applications throughout the complete use case lifecycle
What can you expect in this role?
Data Engineer is expected to design, develop, test, implement data ingestion, transformation, and extraction to and from Big Data/cloud Platforms using tools and technologies including but not limited to spark frameworks, Sqoop, Hive, HBase, Impala, Python, Scala ,ControlM, Big query, Databricks, Datafusion Kafka and shell scriptingHands-on application design, coding, and deployment of medium and significant Complex data PipelinesClose collaboration across engineering team on product strategies that align with business pain points andAbility to understand requirements, create BSTM, build business logic and ability to learn and quickly adopt for changing needsActively participate in addressing non-functional requirements such as performance, security, scalability, continuous integration, migration and compatibilityContribute to Best practices of data ingestion, transformation and extraction solutions in big data platform (Datahub) and Cloud Data platformsExperience in building Data Architectures and exposure to Dimensional Data ModelingTake ownership from design of the feature through first lines of code to how it performs in production (You build it, you run it)Ensure fully automated testing by designing and writing automated unit, integration and acceptance testsActs as a SME / Trusted day-to-day advisor to development teams on application portfolio, SDLC and development design frameworks, components and services re-useProvides key inputs into future technology direction and areas associated stability, performance, and roadmap strategy and development initiatives for applications in the portfolioStrong experience in using DevOps toolsChampions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environmentResponsible for creating functions, applications or databases that run on the cloud
What do you bring to the role?
BS/MS in computer science or equivalent technical experienceShould have worked in Hadoop ,cloud and Data Engineering space for at least 2+ yearsMinimum of 4 to 6 years of development experience handling variety of data (structured/unstructured), data formats (flat files, XML, JSON, relational, legacy, parquet)Experience in developing batch and real time data streams to create meaningful insights and analyticsStrong understanding of different file formats (e.g. AVRO, ORC, Parquet, etc..) and data sources moving data into and out of HDFSCoding background in either Java, Spark or Python, some experience with Shell and Ansible writingGood knowledge of issue tracking (Jira), source code management (Bitbucket), Continuous Integrations tools (Jenkins), Linux/Mac OS administration, build tools, package management and testing framework.Good knowledge of networking, CPU, memory, storageGood to have Cloud Experience and cloud data technologiesWorking Experience with ETL/ELT toolsExperience in Cloud Engineering (Google Cloud Experience is an asset)Should have worked under agile methodologyEfficient in communication, able to work with cross teams
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).
companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Get to know our family of companies:
Economical Insurance
Sonnet Insurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline Insurance
-
Definity investit dans des activités multicanaux afin d’offrir à nos concitoyens canadiens des options de couverture optimales pour leurs domiciles, véhicules, fermes, animaux de compagnie et entreprises.

Nous sommes fiers d’être Canadiens et nous offrons une gamme de solutions d’assurance adaptées ainsi qu’un service à nos clients d’un bout à l’autre du pays. Definity a des racines profondes, qui remontent au 25 novembre 1871, lorsque notre marque fondatrice, l’Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, a émis sa première police pour protéger l’étable et la maison d’Ismael D. Bowman. Aujourd’hui, Definity poursuit sa tradition d’offrir aux Canadiens un excellent service, tant par l’entremise d’un courtier d’assurance autorisé que par notre réseau numérique direct.

Découvrez notre famille de compagnies :
Assurance Economical
Sonnet Assurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline

jobDescription: Leads engineering project team:  - Sets day to day assignments for Oversight Engineers assigned to project- Provides guidance and mentorship for Oversight Engineers- Deals with project technical issues raised by Oversight Engineers- Manages all project engineering decision records (EDR) and facilitates necessary approvals - Manages all project Specification or Material Waivers and facilitates necessary approvals - Provides timely information on project engineering status to functional leadership (Manger and Director) Manages the Engineering Service Provider (ESP)- Leads development of scope of work- Supply's Spectra Energy Standards & Specifications to ESP- Defines content and quality of deliverables- Point contact with ESP for all technical issues- Monitors quality and timeliness of deliverables- Monitors engineering cost and schedule- Provides functional leadership cost trends and forecasts- Maintains a risk log within conjunction with the ESP- Manages ESP change notification process, communicates changes to functional leadership Require a bachelor's degree and 10+ years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with engineering concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Leads and directs the work of others. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department. Experience with natural gas transmission compressor station design. Brownfield design experience is an asset.If interested contact Melissa at 403-809-4215 or melissa.hughes@manpower.com

Manpower has been operating in Alberta for more than 50 years, and is strategically aligned and committed to provide solutions and deliver the right people at the right time, at the best value. Combining global reach and local expertise, we know the world of work and each market where we operate. 

We are able to surpass the needs of our clients across Alberta & with our experience in temporary staffing, managed on-site services, permanent placement, professional/executive placement and contract payroll services,  few companies can match Manpower’s progress in the world of work. Take a look at where we’ve been and who we are today. Our presence. Our leaders. Our vision and values. 

You’ll see an unwavering commitment to our clients’ and candidates’ success.

jobDescription:
Description
My client is looking for a full-time Business Analyst specialist who has extensive experience in future state information gathering. The successful individual will, in collaboration with the existing HSPnet project team, assess the needs and determine the business requirements, priorities and change readiness that will help inform a future state roadmap. They will work with stakeholders such as health organizations, educational organizations such as post-secondary institutions, and students. 
Requirements
· Minimum 10 years' experience as a change management specialist or business analyst in the healthcare sector in Canada· Experience working with the Health Authorities in BC· Extensive knowledge and understanding of clinical practice and workflows in healthcare delivery· Working knowledge of clinical services, information technology and healthcare systems· Ability to effectively navigate and deliver results in a large and complex environment· Strong forward thinking, analytical, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills

jobTitle: Analyste d’affaires, finances senior (intégration des systèmes STF)
jobDescription:
Sous la responsabilité du Chef, Intégration des Systèmes, STF, l’analyste d’affaires finance, Intégration des Systèmes, STF doit aider le chef à coordonner les tests d’acceptation par l’utilisateur ayant une incidence sur les équipes des comptes recevables, des comptes payables et de la comptabilité des ventes et des remises. Le titulaire du poste est également chargé de la mise en place et de l’exécution des tests d’acceptation par l’utilisateur influant sur l’ensemble des systèmes de vente de pâtes et papiers ainsi que la journalisation des transactions de ventes brutes à nettes pour la pâte et le papier.
De plus, il épaule le Chef, Intégration des Systèmes, STF dans la mise en œuvre de changements visant à optimiser les processus d’affaires.Le titulaire du poste devra développer une connaissance suffisante des fonctions financières des équipes responsables des systèmes de transactions financières afin de supporter ces équipes pour les billets de service TI et les projets lors des essais d’acceptation par l’utilisateur.
Ceci est un poste qui requiert une expérience ou formation en finance en plus d'expérience en intégration des systèmes TI
Principales ResponsabilitésComprendre les implications des différents projets sur l’équipe, les tests qui seront nécessaires, les modifications possibles aux processus d’affaires, ainsi que les changements aux rôles et responsabilités :Soutenir le gestionnaire dans l’intégration des systèmes STF avec des projets ayant un impact sur les comptes clients, les comptes fournisseurs et l'équipe de comptabilité des ventes et de remises.Développer une connaissance suffisante des fonctions financières assignées au sein du groupe de soutien aux transactions financières pour soutenir les équipes STF dans les projetsFournir un soutien technique et faire preuve de leadership afin d’assurer que les besoins de l'entreprise sont satisfaitsFournir des conseils et des recommandations de système aux responsables de secteur d'activitéDévelopper et exécuter des tests d’acceptation par l’utilisateur pour les différents départements STF, basé sur les changements ou projets TI, ainsi que fournir les résultats de ces tests au Chef STF responsable.Représenter les équipes STF lors des réunions de système et fournir un soutien à la coordination des tests d’acceptation des utilisateurs pour les changements TI ainsi que pour les projets ayant un impact sur les équipes STF ainsi que sur d’autres groupes du département des finances.
Compétences ClésGrandes compétences analytiques et d’investigation, et capacité de comprendre une situation dans son ensemble;Compétences solides en matière d’analyses d’affaires et de résolutions de problèmes;Capacité de comprendre les changements organisationnels et leurs incidences sur les processus d’affaires;Souci du détail exceptionnel et compétences interpersonnelles éprouvées;Grand sens de l’organisation et forte aptitude à établir les priorités;Capacité à travailler et à collaborer avec des équipes diversifiées;Rigueur et intégrité, orienté service client;Excellentes compétences en communication et maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (à l’écrit et à l’oral).
Expérience Professionnelle Et QualificationsBaccalauréat en comptabilité, ou combinaison d’études ou d’expérience équivalente3 à 5 ans d’expérience en comptabilité;Un travail lié aux finances ainsi qu'une expérience dans les tests d'acceptation par les utilisateurs serait préférableCapacité à appliquer les connaissances des modules du système d'affaires liés aux domaines d'activité de la finance et à maintenir une compréhension des interdépendances avec d'autres modulesPlusieurs années d’expérience avec différents systèmes de facturation ou comptables (système de gestion intégrée ou système indépendant, de préférence SAP et JDE);Expérience de travail sur différents projets (en gestion de projets, un atout).Maîtrise avancée de la suite Microsoft Office, en particulier Excel;
Domtar applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité et invite les femmes, les minorités visibles, les Autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature.
Notre OffreUn emplacement au cœur du centre-ville (métro Place des Arts);Modalités d’aménagement du temps de travail; télétravail hybride et l’horaire flexible;Un environnement de travail moderne et spacieux;Une rémunération concurrentielle, incluant un régime de boni annuel;Un plan d’assurance « À la carte » (vie, soins médicaux, dentaires);Un programme d’aide aux employés;Un régime de retraite avec participation de l’employeur;Du développement et de la formation continue payés par l’employeurUn Centre de la Petite Enfance sur place.
À propos
Domtar est un important fournisseur d'un large éventail de produits à base de fibre, dont des papiers de communication, de spécialité et d’emballage, de la pâte commerciale ainsi que des produits non-tissés air-laid. Les ventes annuelles de Domtar s'élèvent à près de 3,7 milliards de dollars.
Comptant près de 5800 employés au service de clients dans plus de 50 pays, Domtar est animée par la volonté de transformer la fibre de bois durable en produits utiles sur lesquels les gens peuvent compter au quotidien. Fidèles à nos valeurs que sont l’agilité, l’engagement et l’innovation, nous trouvons toujours de meilleures façons de répondre aux besoins de nos clients, de soutenir nos employés et de renforcer nos collectivités.
companyDescription:
Domtar makes products that people around the world rely on every day. We design, manufacture, market and distribute a wide variety of fiber-based products including communication, specialty and packaging papers, market pulp and airlaid nonwovens. With approximately 6,000 employees serving more than 50 countries around the world, Domtar is driven by a commitment to turn sustainable wood fiber into useful products that people rely on every day. Domtar’s principal executive office is in Fort Mill, South Carolina and Domtar is part of the Paper Excellence group of companies.

But how we do things is as important as what we do. In every industry we serve, we continually find ways to do a better job. Develop a better product. Improve a manufacturing process. Manage natural resources responsibly and make the best use of every asset we have. We work efficiently, lead quietly and let our products and customer service do the talking. 

Throughout our history, we’ve relied on our agility to meet the demands of an evolving world. Today, our spirit of innovation drives deliberate improvement and our commitment to caring runs deep. We constantly find better way to serve our customers, support our employees and strengthen our communities. It’s just our way of doing things.

jobDescription:
Data Collection
Looking for a great way to earn extra cash while you are at home? Help improve AI technology through data collection.
What exactly is Data Collection Job?
As a data collector, you enter information into a database and ensure that your data collection sources are accurate. Data collection is the process of gathering and measuring information on variables of interest, in an established systematic fashion that enables one to answer stated research questions and evaluate outcomes.
This project aims to tap into the collective intelligence of the public at large. This project allows researchers to collect large amounts of interesting data points from a wide variety of individuals and allows people who like annotation work the opportunity to participate in a variety of tasks. The results of tasks will be used in a wide variety of applications - data annotation, multimedia, sentiment analysis, and search engine result evaluation.
Project Requirements:Eligible to work in the United States you are currently located in and resided in for the past 5 yearsMust be flexible to learn new sets of standards and can work independentlyHave experience in using web browsers to navigate and evaluate different types of contentHave access to a Computer OS, which should be Microsoft Vista, Microsoft Windows 7, and above
What to expect when you register:Create an Appen AccountChoose English (Canada) as your primary languageComplete your profile and project registration [5 min]Study the provided guidelines [at your own pace]Agree to confidentiality and ways of working rulesPass the quiz
Don’t miss the chance to earn extra income working from the comfort of your own home. This is a great opportunity for you and your friends!
• Work from home with flexible hours• You can work on our projects around your other jobs

Thank you and we hope to work with you soon!
"Appen has a diverse, inclusive culture that is vital to our mission of helping build better AI. We offer opportunities for individuals of all abilities and backgrounds."
companyDescription:
We help our clients enhance their best-in-class products and services around the world, including search engines, social media platforms, voice recognition systems, sentiment analysis, and eCommerce sites. All of that wouldn’t be possible without our team of more than 1 million flexible workers. The world of tech is moving fast, and we help our clients meet the ever-changing needs of their customers. We take pride in our diverse, international team and the flexible and full-time opportunities we offer.

Remote work is changing how the world does business, and we’re proud to be pioneers in the movement. If you’re looking for a work-from-home opportunity, join us! At Appen, our team is an international force to be reckoned with. Operating in over 130 countries and working in more than 180 languages and dialects, we support the work of some of the world’s top technology companies. With Appen, you’ll get to work on innovative projects and grow your skills – all on your own schedule.

Please be aware that Appen recruiters will only reach out to you via official channels (e.g., directly from @appen.com email addresses, or through our recruiters who are noted as such on LinkedIn). If you have suspicions about an interaction, ask for official email communications from an @appen.com. We will never ask you to send money to apply or start a job with us. We will also never send a check in advance. We will never ask you to send personal identifiable information outside of our secure job site, Appen Connect. All job applications should be submitted through our Jobs page to the applicable site.
